
```{r}
library(VIM)
library(Amelia)

# Sample dataset with missing values
data <- data.frame(
  ID    = 1:8,
  Name  = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Eve", NA, "Grace", "Henry"),
  Age   = c(25, NA, 30, 28, NA, 35, 29, NA),
  Score = c(90, 85, NA, 88, 92, 80, NA, 75)
)

data


```

## VIM

- aggr() → Summary of missing data by variable (counts & percentages).

- matrixplot() → Row-by-row missingness pattern.

```{r}
# Basic aggregation plot of missingness
aggr(data, numbers = TRUE, sortVars = TRUE, labels = names(data), cex.axis = 0.7,
     gap = 3, ylab = c("Missing Data", "Pattern"))

matrixplot(data)
```

 ## Amelia
 
- missmap() → Heatmap of missing values (bright vs dark cells).

- Works best if non-numeric columns are converted to factors.

```{r}
# amelia() requires only numeric or factor variables (character columns should be factors)
data_factor <- data
data_factor$Name <- as.factor(data_factor$Name)

# Missingness map
missmap(data_factor, main = "Amelia Missingness Map",
        col = c("yellow", "black"), legend = TRUE)


```
